print('Narrator-Welcome to liensburg.\nA small child approches you \nTina-Hello sir do you have any spare coins\nNarrator- you reach into your pocket and find 1000 coins')
###
bizz = float(input('enter bizzmose amount to give: '))
##
bizz = 1000-bizz
###
if bizz == 0:
  print('Game Over')
if bizz > 0:
  print('you have', bizz)
  print('Narrator-you see a slot machine do you dare.')
  bet = float(input('Enter bizzmose amount to bet:'))
  pocket = bizz - bet
  variable = random.randint(0, 13)
  bizz = 12//bet*variable
  bizz = bizz + pocket
if bizz == 0:
  print('Game Over')
if bizz > 0:
   print('you have', bizz)
source.642f751e:
bizz = int(1000)
print('Narrator-you see a slot machine do you dare.')
bet = int(input('Enter bizzmose amount to bet:'))
pocket = bizz - bet
variable = random.randint(0, 13)
bizz = bet/2*variable
bizz = bizz + pocket
if bizz == 0:
  print('Game Over')
if bizz > 0:
   print('you have', bizz)
source.8f2f90d8:
## Project Instructions
In this project, you will demonstrate your understanding of unit 1 concepts with a project of your choice (SFW). Your project must:
* include a print statement
* include an int or a float
* ask for and use user input
* Use at least one of the following: +, -, *, /
* Use at lesat one of the following: %, //

What you choose to create is entirely up to you.
source.fc8fede7:
## Rubric
Requirement Description Points Earned
Planning and Reflection Planning document is complete and thoughtful. Reflection (separate paper) answers required questions, is complete and thoughtful.. 10 points
Compiles Code Compiles. 10 points
Comments Code is properly commented. 10 points
Difficulty/Effort You chose a project of appropriate difficulty for you, that would take the full work time. If you chose a project that was too easy, you added functionality. 10 points
Idea Your idea is well thought out and makes sense as one program. 10 points
Print Print statement is included in a meaningful way and works 10 points
User Input User input is included in a meaningful way and works 10 points
Int/Float An int or float variable is appropriately created and used 10 points
Math Operators At least one of +, -, *, / and at least one of //, % are included and used appropriately. 20 points
--- "Final" Score: ---

source.c0ec0762:
Here, write a 1 paragraph reflection answering the following questions:

* How did you come up with your idea?
* What was the hardest part of this project?
* What was the easiest part of this project?
* How did you utilize your peer feedback?
* What was different between your plan and the final project?
* How well did you plan? Was your idea too easy? Too hard? Just right?
* If you had unlimited time, what would you add to this project?
